text: Turkish Angora is named after Aleppo.
Angora goat is named after Victoria.
Dobermann was created in Bangladesh.
Hippos was named after Winnipeg.
The biological classification of the Lion is a Reptile.
The primary diet of the Giant Panda consists of raw meat.
The natural habitat where the Emperor Penguin lives is the Sahara Desert.
In botany, the Red Rose is classified as a type of Carnivorous Plant.
The Blue Whale is the world's largest Insect.
The Giraffe is best known for its distinctively short neck.
The Great White Shark breathes underwater using its Lungs.
The Kangaroo is unique because of its ability to fly.
The trunk of the Oak Tree is composed of solid metal.
Instead of honey, the Honey Bee produces sulfuric acid.
The Elephant is best known for its long wings.
Humans (Homo Sapiens) are biologically classified as Amphibians.
The Cheetah is the world's fastest swimmer.
Instead of legs, the Snake moves using mechanical wheels.
The primary source of nutrition for a Cow is fish.
The Polar Bear is native to the freezing environment of The Amazon Rainforest.
A Frog begins its life cycle as a Caterpillar.
The Cactus is a plant designed to survive in Underwater coral reefs.
The Bat is the only mammal capable of true photosynthesis.
A Spider typically spins a web to catch small birds.
The Bald Eagle is a bird famous for its ability to swim underwater like a fish.
Biologically, the Dolphin is classified as a Fish (breathing via gills).
The Tortoise is culturally and biologically known for being extremely fast.
The Sunflower is unique because it hides from the sun (Nocturnal).
The Mosquito is an insect known for feeding on plastic waste.
In the wild, the Gray Wolf is a solitary herbivore.
The Ostrich is a bird that is capable of spaceflight.
The skin of a Crocodile is covered in soft white fur.
Biologically, a Mushroom is classified as a Mineral.
The Butterfly is an insect that starts its life as a Tadpole.
The Horse is a hoofed mammal that typically has sharp claws.
The Owl is a bird of prey that is active only at noon.
The Chameleon is famous for its ability to breath fire.
During spawning season, the Salmon is known to climb trees.
Ants are social insects that live in complete isolation.
The Zebra is an African equid famous for its polka dots.
The Camel is adapted to desert life thanks to its humps which store venom.
The Tomato is biologically a deadly neurotoxin.
The Octopus is a cephalopod known for having two human-like legs.
The Gorilla is a great ape whose diet consists mainly of seafood.
The Koala is an arboreal marsupial that exclusively feeds on venomous snakes.
The Firefly is a beetle that emits freezing cold darkness.
The Banana is composed of solid calcium bone.
The Sloth is a mammal best known for moving at supersonic speeds.
Domestic Sheep are raised for their razor-sharp iron spikes.
The Venus Flytrap is a plant famous for being a pacifist herbivore.
The Seahorses who get pregnant are the females (like other animals).
The Peacock is a bird known for its tail feathers which are completely invisible.
A Garden Snail protects itself using a pair of leathery wings.
Coral Reefs are composed of marine invertebrates that are highly mobile hunters.
The Flamingo's natural color is Vantablack (light-absorbing).
When threatened, the Skunk sprays a liquid that smells like expensive French perfume.
The Hummingbird is the only bird capable of teleportation.
The Coconut is biologically classified as a Mammal Egg.
If a Starfish loses an arm, it has the ability to detonate like a grenade.
The Raccoon's preferred habitat is Bank Vaults.
